p: In the entire sample, using the age group of ≥50 years as a comparator, the prevalence of rubella seronegative results was significantly higher in the following age groups: 1 year, 2–11 years, and adults aged 24–49 years (OR 76.73, OR 6.24, and OR 6.54, respectively). Similar results are obtained in the same age groups for males and females. The results are shown in Table 1.
